title: Uses of Verlag from Hoefler & Frere-Jones
content:
Anyone can point (or show) examples of uses of Verlag from Hoefler & Frere-Jones?  
Any other fonts in the same line?

Thanks!  
António

 [‹ Why can't people educate themselves about ampersands?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828032437/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45277 "Go to previous forum topic") [Do ypu know what's the name of this types? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828032437/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45342 "Go to next forum topic")
author: afonseca1974

comments.content:
Hi António,

have you tried it [this way](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828032437/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20verlag)?  
F

The font was originally designed for the Guggenheim Museum and can still be seen on their web site and many of their publications

[http://www.guggenheim.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828032437/http:/www.guggenheim.org/ "http://www.guggenheim.org/")

I used it recently on this book

[http://www.aperture.org/store/books-detail-promo.aspx?ID=638](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828032437/http:/www.aperture.org/store/books-detail-promo.aspx?ID=638 "http://www.aperture.org/store/books-detail-promo.aspx?ID=638")

“Any other fonts in the same line?”

what do you mean? fonts that look the same?

dr

David R  
Sans serif, “round” and with a big family...:-)

António

Houschka, Proxima Nova, Gotham, Futura, Avant-Garde, Mostra, Avenir.

dr
